item.description:
The Grownup Noise is one of my favorite local bands, and I'm psyched to hear them in a nice big venue! Also psyched to share the stage with them (see below).
Here's what the press says about them:

http://www.avclub.com/artists/the-grownup-noise,8828/

"The Grownup Noise’s best asset... is the songwriting, with lines of love and the changing seasons coming out as gently and colorful as the music itself."

http://www.boston.com/ae/music/articles/2011/07/08/the_grownup_noise_hit_its_stride_on_sophomore_album/

"sincerity, wonder, and poetry"

Anyway, they're great, trust me. The other bands of the night include:

Lowman (full disclosure, I'm the bandleader of this one, so I'll have to jump up onstage at that point ;)

http://lowman.bandcamp.com/

Red Star Super Giant

http://redstarsupergiant.bandcamp.com

and a group coming up from NY called The Regulars:

http://www.reverbnation.com/WeAreTheRegulars

“This album reminds me of the way I want rock to be - it's fun, sometimes sad, sometimes bold, and the lyrics matter.” Joni - DigStation

And the South Shore Music Hall is a nice big (500 capacity) recently refurbished basement venue in the style of the Middle East Downstairs; obviously with less history, but with cheaper covers and beers.

We could meet beforehand around the corner; The Fours looks like an ok place, or the Half Door would probably be... entertaining...

21+, $7 cover

tickets available here:

http://www.ticketfly.com/event/255655-grownup-noise-quincy/
item.name: The Grownup Noise (+Lowman, Red Star Super Giant & The Regulars) @ SS Music Hall
